required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Comparing Blood Levels of Fatty Acids After Consuming Two Forms of Cod Liver Oil
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Plasma Levels of n-3 Fatty Acids After Ingestion of an Emulsified Cod Liver Oil Product and a Non Emulsified Cod Liver Oil Product

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to compare the incremental area under the curve from 0 to 24h (iAUC0-24h) of plasma levels of n-3 fatty acids (sum of total and free eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA) and docosahexaenoic acid (DHA)) after ingestion of an emulsified product and a non-emulsified reference control of free flowing cod liver oil at the lowest appropriate dose that is practically acceptable, and as near as possible to the test products' recommended daily dose.

detailed_description.textblock: Many dietary lipids are in the form of triglycerides, ethyl esters or phospholipids. During digestion these lipids are subject to hydrolysis, in particular by pancreatic triglyceride lipase. To facilitate the action of the enzyme, lipids are emulsified by the action of bile salts. By increasing the surface area of the fat globules, emulsification increases access to the lipids by pancreatic triglyceride lipase. This study is designed to compare iAUC0-24h of plasma levels of n-3 fatty acids (sum of total and free EPA and DHA) after ingestion of an emulsified product and a non-emulsified reference control of free flowing cod liver oil at the lowest appropriate dose that is practically acceptable, and as near as possible to the test products' recommended daily dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Incremental Area Under the Curve to 24 Hours (h) (iAUC0-24h) of the Sum of Plasma Total and Free n-3 Fatty Acids (Docosahexaenoic Acid (DHA) and Eicosapentaenoic Acid (EPA)
primary_outcome.description: The AUC was calculated using the trapezoidal method and using nominal time points from 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12 and 24 h respectively. The AUC was divided by the total duration to represent a weighted mean incremental change over time. Higher values of AUC demonstrate better rate of absorption over time than lower values.

secondary_outcome.measure: iAUC0-24h of Sum of Total and Free DHA
secondary_outcome.description: The AUC was calculated using the trapezoidal method and using nominal time points from 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12 and 24 h respectively. The AUC was divided by the total duration to represent a weighted mean incremental change over time. Higher values of AUC demonstrate better rate of absorption over time than lower values.

secondary_outcome.measure: iAUC0-24h of Sum of Total and Free EPA
secondary_outcome.description: The AUC was calculated using the trapezoidal method and using nominal time points from 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12 and 24 h respectively. The AUC was divided by the total duration to represent a weighted mean incremental change over time. Higher values of AUC demonstrate better rate of absorption over time than lower values.

secondary_outcome.measure: iAUC0-10h of Sum of Total and Free DHA
secondary_outcome.description: The AUC was calculated using the trapezoidal method and using nominal time points from 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 10h respectively. The AUC was divided by the total duration to represent a weighted mean incremental change over time. Higher values of AUC demonstrate better rate of absorption over time than lower values.

secondary_outcome.measure: iAUC0-10h of Sum of Total and Free EPA
secondary_outcome.description: The AUC was calculated using the trapezoidal method and using nominal time points from 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 10h respectively. The AUC was divided by the total duration to represent a weighted mean incremental change over time. Higher values of AUC demonstrate better rate of absorption over time than lower values.

secondary_outcome.measure: iAUC0-10h of Sum of Total and Free DHA and EPA
secondary_outcome.description: The AUC was calculated using the trapezoidal method and using nominal time points from 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 10h respectively. The AUC was divided by the total duration to represent a weighted mean incremental change over time. Higher values of AUC demonstrate better rate of absorption over time than lower values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Concentration (Cmax) of Sum of Total and Free DHA and EPA
secondary_outcome.description: Blood sampleswere taken at time points 0,2,4,6,8,10,12 and 24h. Maximum plasma concentration was determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cmax of Sum of Total and Free DHA
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were taken at time points 0,2,4,6,8,10,12 and 24h. Maximum plasma concentration was determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cmax of Sum of Total and Free EPA
secondary_outcome.description: Blood sampleswere taken at time points 0,2,4,6,8,10,12 and 24h. Maximum plasma concentration was determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Concentration (Tmax) of Sum of Total and Free DHA and EPA
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be taken at time points 0,2,4,6,8,10,12 and 24h. Time to maximum concentration was determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Tmax of Sum of Total and Free DHA
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be taken at time points 0,2,4,6,8,10,12 and 24h. Time to maximum concentration was determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Tmax of Sum of Total and Free EPA
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be taken at time points 0,2,4,6,8,10,12 and 24h.Time to maximum concentration was determined.

arm_group.description: 30mL Test contains 10%w/w cod oil + 10%w/w cod liver oil in an emulsion formulation
5.8mL of cod liver oil in a free flowing non-emulsified formulation

intervention.description: Participants are required to consume the dose (30 mL) within 1 min, followed by up to 300 mL of apple juice which needs to be consumed within 2 min
Participants are required to consume the dose (5.8 mL) within 1 min, followed by up to 300 mL of apple juice which needs to be consumed within 2 min

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers aged 18 to 45 years (both inclusive)
- Body mass index (BMI) of 18.5-29.9 kg/m2 inclusive
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or lactating women
- Allergy/intolerance to any study material
- Current or recurrent disease, within 12 months of screening that could affect the metabolism of drug
- Participants who have taken any drug known to induce or inhibit hepatic drug metabolism in 30 days prior to screening
- Positive serum Hepatitis B surface antigen, Hepatitis C antibodies or Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV), alcohol or drug abuse
- Smokers taking >5 cigarettes/day; prior or current use of any other nicotine containing product
- Blood donated within 3 months of screening
- Consumed n-3 rich food or beverage or n-3 fortified food or beverage within 72h prior to each study session

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited at one Centre in United Kingdom.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 93 participants were screened, out of which 50 participants were randomized. 39 participants failed screening and 2 participants withdrew from the study. 2 participants discontinued due to other reasons (reason not specified).

group.title: Scott's Emulsion Followed by Non Emulsified Cod Liver Oil
group.description: Sequence 1: Participants were administered 30 milliliters (mL) of Scott's emulsion (10 percent [%] Cod Liver Oil, 10% Cod Oil) followed by 300 mL of apple juice in period 1. After a washout period of 2 weeks participants were administered 5.8 mL non emulsified cod liver oil, followed by 300 ml apple juice in period 2.

group.title: Non Emulsified Cod Liver Oil Followed by Scott's Emulsion
group.description: Sequence 2: Firstly, participants were administered 5.8 mL non emulsified cod liver oil, followed by 300 mL of apple juice in Period 1. After a washout period of 2 weeks participants were administered test product i.e. 30 mL of Scott’s emulsion (10 % Cod Liver Oil, 10% Cod Oil) followed by 300 mL apple juice in period 2.

baseline.population: Safety population (N=50) was analysis population, defined as all participants who were randomized and administered at least one study treatment during the study.

group.title: Overall Study
group.description: Test product : 30 mL Scott’s Emulsion containing 10% Cod Liver Oil, 10% Cod Oil. Reference product: 5.8 mL of non emulsified free flowing cod liver oil

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Incremental Area Under the Curve to 24 Hours (h) (iAUC0-24h) of the Sum of Plasma Total and Free n-3 Fatty Acids (Docosahexaenoic Acid (DHA) and Eicosapentaenoic Acid (EPA)
outcome.description: The AUC was calculated using the trapezoidal method and using nominal time points from 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12 and 24 h respectively. The AUC was divided by the total duration to represent a weighted mean incremental change over time. Higher values of AUC demonstrate better rate of absorption over time than lower values.
outcome.population: Per protocol (PP) population (N=47) was the primary population of analysis defined as all participants in the safety population who have at least one post-baseline assessment of efficacy considered unaffected by protocol violations. From the PP population, 3 participants were not analysed in test group and 2 in control group, due to missing data.

group.title: Test Product
group.description: 30 mL Scott’s emulsion containing 10% cod liver Oil, and 10% cod oil

group.title: Reference Product
group.description: 5.8 mL of non emulsified free flowing cod liver oil

measure.title: Incremental Area Under the Curve to 24 Hours (h) (iAUC0-24h) of the Sum of Plasma Total and Free n-3 Fatty Acids (Docosahexaenoic Acid (DHA) and Eicosapentaenoic Acid (EPA)
measure.description: The AUC was calculated using the trapezoidal method and using nominal time points from 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12 and 24 h respectively. The AUC was divided by the total duration to represent a weighted mean incremental change over time. Higher values of AUC demonstrate better rate of absorption over time than lower values.
measure.population: Per protocol (PP) population (N=47) was the primary population of analysis defined as all participants in the safety population who have at least one post-baseline assessment of efficacy considered unaffected by protocol violations. From the PP population, 3 participants were not analysed in test group and 2 in control group, due to missing data.

analysis.method_desc: Subject as random effect,treatment and period as fixed effects,subject and period level baseline values for plasma total and free acids as covariates
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference is test minus reference such that a positive difference favors the test treatment.

reported_events.desc: Safety population (N=50) included all participants who were randomized and administered at least one study treatment during the study (47 participants were treated with both Scott’s Emulsion Original and Cod liver oil; 1 participant was treated with Scott’s Emulsion only and 2 were treated with Cod liver oil only). Therefore, a total of 48 participants were included in Scotts emulsion (test product) arm and 49 in Cod liver oil (reference product) arm.

group.title: Test Product
group.description: 30 mL Scott’s Emulsion containing 10% cod liver oil, 10% cod oil

group.title: Reference Product
group.description: 5.8 mL of non emulsified free flowing cod liver oil

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
